intro: Aceras anthropophorum var. balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly the Balearic Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
